input: Consider the following statement : P. Part III of the Constitution of India dealing with Fundamental Rights is not applicable to the state of Jammu & Kashmir Q. Part IV of the Constitution of India dealing with Directive Principles is applicable to the state of Jammu & Kashmir with some exceptions and conditions Which of the statements given above is/are correct ?
explanation: Part IV (Directive Principles of the State Policy) and Part IVA (Fundamental Duties) of the Constitution are not applicable to J&K. In addition to other fundamental rights, Articles 19(1)(f) and 31(2) of the Constitution are still applicable to J&K; hence the Fundamental Right to property is still guaranteed in this state.
